description: From Irish poitín (“little pot; poteen”), from pota (“pot”) (from Middle English potte, ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *budn- (“type of vessel”)) + -ín (“suffix forming diminutives”).

entries.meaning: (Ireland, countable, uncountable) Illegally produced Irish whiskey; moonshine. [from early 19th c.]
examples: Last night he had put down too much Potheen / (A vulgar blend of Methyl and Benzene) / That, at some Wake, he might the better keen. / (Keen—meaning ‘brisk’? Nay, here the Language warps: / ’Tis singing bawdy Ballads to a Corpse.)

entries.meaning: (Ireland, countable, by extension) An unlicensed drinking establishment selling illegally produced Irish whiskey.
